formattedAddress: 5 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 5 Greenwich Ave, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: I have never had a good experience here, always some kind of up sell, or extra charge. I went again because I have zero dollar copay insurance. They made an appointment for me, got me in and then informed me they didn't have the frames for zero dollar co-pay, and I would ha e to buy frames from them.

originalText.text: Dr. Newmark seems like a nice guy but this place needs improvement. There’s a very weird smell throughout the place, and the assistant was fairly rude to me and another customer in there. There are a bunch of optometrists in the city, and I wouldn’t recommend this one.

text.text: Dr. Newmark seems like a nice guy but this place needs improvement. There’s a very weird smell throughout the place, and the assistant was fairly rude to me and another customer in there. There are a bunch of optometrists in the city, and I wouldn’t recommend this one.

originalText.text: This is great neighborhood Cohen's Optical, with personable and GREAT service, not to mention, a FABULOUS selection of glasses!! Alex, Val and Irmlyn are always a joy to work with, and I wouldn't go anywhere else for my glasses!

text.text: This is great neighborhood Cohen's Optical, with personable and GREAT service, not to mention, a FABULOUS selection of glasses!! Alex, Val and Irmlyn are always a joy to work with, and I wouldn't go anywhere else for my glasses!

originalText.text: Basically I could copy and paste from other reviews since this is clearly the general situation at this shop. Optometrist is attentive and professional, very nice person, his service was great , I was happy but then,  salesman was rude just because I said I was not going to buy the glasses at the shop. The truth is they are over priced, nowadays with lots of options online, I am not going to pay $160 for glasses plus $60 for eye exam when online, I get the same for 2$0 or less. This salesman had such bad attitude, made me feel very uncomfortable. Two days later I called asking them for the PD number (Pupillary Distance) since I need it for ordering online.  He was so rude on the phone again,  the worst customer service call ever, he told me if I wanted the extra number it would be another $25 unless I wanted to buy the glasses there!!!!! I said I already paid $60 for eye exam, my prescription should provide all the numbers I need to get my glasses anywhere, he insisted with the worst manners possible that I had to pay other $25 if I wanted a complete prescription.

originalText.text: Nice doctor and staff. Pretty frames. ZERO quality. Their glasses are the worst quality I ever had; from the beginning the little screws often came off, the temples had to be put in shape all the time, and finally one temple broke off. When I took them back Cohen's said their glasses had no warranty and suggested I must have sat on them because the unbroken temple was crooked. They proposed that I buy the same frame again. I feel ripped off. The "made in china" $5 emergency glasses I bought four months ago are still in shape. Cohen's glasses are a 50 cents value.
